event.title: was invaded by Boer forces on October 14, 1899

data.event: During the Anglo-Boer War, Newcastle was invaded by Boer forces on October 14, 1899, and the entire district was incorporated into the Transvaal Republic.

event.title: lasted for a period of seven months

data.event: Newcastle's name lasted for a period of seven months when it was renamed to Viljoensdorp after the commander of the Johannesburg Commando, General Ben Viljoen.
